intro: Chartolepis demirizii, commonly known as the Turkish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its attractive blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and often arranged in clusters, making it a visually striking addition to gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in temperate climates.
